Power of attorney to request for exemption from Digital Post for citizens
cf. the Danish Public Digital Post Act
This form is a translation to English of FD 001F. It is FD 001F that must be completed and handed in at the citizen service centre (borgerservice).

As a general rule, public authorities in Denmark submit post to citizens digitally - Digital Post.
You can be exempt from receiving your post in Digital Post if you meet one of the reasons for exemption below. Instead
you will receive your post in your physical letter box as regular letter post.

5 708410 042294

Initials

Municipality of the holder of the power of attorney

You can obtain exemption by completing the form FD 001A Request for exemption from Digital Post and by showing up
in person at the citizen service centre (borgerservice) of your municipality. If you do not show up in person, you can
request for exemption by completing this form and giving it to a person who can submit it for you to the citizen service
centre (borgerservice) of your municipality.
The exemption does not cover post which according to other legislation can only be sent by Digital Post. In situations in
which the exemption does not apply, the relevant authority will inform you about this.
If you only need help to read your digital post, instead of applying for exemption you can grant another person access to
read your post in Digital Post. The citizen service centre (borgerservice) can set up reading access. You must show up in
person at the citizen service centre (borgerservice) or complete the form FD 011 Power of attorney to set up reading
access.
By signing this form, I declare that I wish to be exempt from Digital Post, because
I meet one of the following reasons for exemption:
I have left Denmark permanently
I am no longer registered with a permanent address or place of accommodation in Denmark
I have practical difficulties in procuring the public digital signature (NemID)
I have a physical or mental disability that prevents me from using Digital Post
I do not master Danish which makes it difficult to use Digital Post
I am a resident in an area where it is not possible to establish an internet connection
(min. 512 kbit/s downstream speed)

I do not have access to a computer in my home or place of accommodation
Please send me written confirmation if I am granted exemption
If there is unread digital post for me, I would like this to be forwarded as regular post
Furthermore, I declare that I have been informed that my declaration has been submitted under penalty of perjury pursuant to
section/§ 163 of the Danish Criminal Code.
Section/§ 163 of the Danish Criminal Code
Any person who for use in legal proceedings relating to
the general public, in writing or by other readable media,
brings forth false statements or testifies to something

about which the person in question has no knowledge,
shall be punished with a fine, or imprisonment not
exceeding four months.

Digital Post and the municipality’s management of your information
Information about your exemption will be registered in Digital Post and will be available to the relevant public authorities.
Other information in connection with the municipality processing your request for exemption from Digital Post will be
registered by the municipality, but only forwarded to other public authorities, enterprises etc. which are legally entitled to
the information or carry out tasks on behalf of the municipality.
You are entitled to know what information the municipality has registered about you. You can require that inaccurate
information is corrected.
I hereby grant a power of attorney to the person below to request for exemption on my behalf
Name • Holder of the power of attorney

Business registration number (CVR
nummer), if a company

Signature
Name • Person requesting exemption

Date

Civil registration number (CPR nummer)
Signature • Person requesting exemption

You can read about the rules on exemption from Digital Post in the form FD 001L Statutory framework for ”Request for
exemption from Digital Post”, form not translated. For more information about Digital Post and your options go to www.
borger.dk or contact the citizen service centre (borgerservice) of your municipality.

The holder of the power of attorney must submit the request personally in the citizen service centre (borgerservice) of
your municipality.
The holder of the power of attorney must bring his/her own health insurance card (sundhedskort) or other similar proof of
identity. If a power of attorney has been granted to a company, the representative of the company must also show documentation of his/her affiliation to the company.

Please send unopened post to this foreign address:
Address

Post code/number

Town/city

Country

We use this foreign address to forward unopened post when you are exempt from Digital Post and live abroad.
You must ensure that you register your foreign address with CPR. You can read more on moving abroad at borger.dk, or
contact borgerservice in the municipality you moved from.
